Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US — a land where anyone from the upper population levels can buy a house (at random, anywhere, with minimal fuss) — is trying to figure out how to cope with one extended family. The Dutch, meanwhile, accept this as standard and develop a kind of self-organizing 'mesoleil' around it.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are taking in an area with radiation with mathematical anomalies that can cause the mind and physical damage and start losing their minds. The members search for a way out while battling their kidnappers.
